Pre-Game Insights: Canada head coach Pubudu Dassanayake expressed disappointment at not being able to play against India, emphasizing the missed opportunity for his players to learn from the Indian team.

The Indian team discussed the need to adapt to different conditions in the West Indies, with batting coach Vikram Rathour highlighting the importance of match practice and the risks of playing in less-than-ideal conditions.
Post-Match Reflections: Canadian players and coach expressed disappointment and frustration at the match being abandoned, with the coach noting it as a missed opportunity to face a top team.
Indian batting coach Vikram Rathour acknowledged the difficulty of not getting match practice but emphasized the focus on upcoming matches and adjusting strategies.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Heavy rain the night before made the outfield unplayable, leading to the match's abandonment.
